1.text: But concerning the times and seasons, brethren, you have no need that anything be written to you.

2.text: You know well that the day of the Lord comes like a thief in the night.

3.text: For when people say, “Peace and safety,” then a sudden destruction will come upon them, like birth pains on a pregnant woman, and they will by no means escape.

4.text: As for you, brethren, you are not in darkness to allow the day to overtake you like a thief.

5.text: You are all children of light, and children of the day. We do not belong to the night, or to the darkness.

6.text: Therefore, let us not sleep as others do, but let us watch and be clear minded.

7.text: Those who sleep, sleep in the night, and those who are drunk are drunk in the night.

8.text: But since we belong to the day, let us be sober, putting on the breastplate of faith and love, and as a helmet, the hope of salvation.

9.text: God did not appoint us to wrath, but to obtain salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ

10.text: who died for us, so that whether we wake or sleep, we should live together with him.

11.text: Therefore, encourage one another and build each other up, which is what you [already] do.

12.text: Now we beg you, brethren, to recognize those who work hard among you, who are set over you in the Lord and who admonish you.

13.text: Respect and honor them in love because of their work. Be at peace among yourselves.

14.text: We exhort you, brethren, admonish the disorderly, encourage the fainthearted, support the weak, be patient toward all.

15.text: See that no one returns evil for evil to anyone, but always pursue what is good, both for one another and for all.

18.text: Give thanks in everything because this is God’s will in Christ Jesus for you.

21.text: but test all things, and hold firmly to what is good.

22.text: Abstain from every form of evil.

23.text: May the God of peace himself sanctify you completely. May your whole spirit, soul, and body be preserved blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.

24.text: He who calls you is faithful and he will carry this out.

26.text: Greet all the brethren with a holy kiss.

27.text: I solemnly instruct you by the Lord that this letter should be read to all the holy brethren.

28.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you! Amen.
